comments.body: Yeah, it's not necessary since this example doesn't use `println` and it looks like all other scala examples are wrapped with this also. Not sure if there was a reason, but doesn't really hurt anything either.

comments.body: All the other examples use `println`, also to explain what is happening. I think it'd be good to add some `print` to explain what is happening. It is an example, thus people reading it would understand better what is happening if you print some details on it. But if you don't add, I'd remove this since it is useless.

comments.body:
I think we can remove it.

It's not uncommon for examples to not have any illustrative `println` statements. In fact many example rather use `show` to show the results.
